title: Android Engineer, Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About Merchant Group**
 Merchant Group comprises Merchant Core, Growth, Operations Management, New Business sub-groups containing 25+ teams . These are cross-functional teams built with different skill sets, and we expect product engineers to collaborate with Data, Design and Product, ensuring we’re fulfilling our Merchants' needs.
   

  

 Merchant products make Wolt an integral part of our Merchants' daily lives. We build tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships. If that's something that gets you excited, don't hesitate to drop in your application.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As an
 **Android Engineer in Wolt’s Merchant Group** 
 , you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of the merchant experience. We are building a brand-new, business-critical product that will empower hundreds of thousands of restaurants, supermarkets, and retailers to serve millions of customers worldwide - and you’ll have the opportunity to influence it from its very first line of code.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll design, implement, and refine the tools that merchants use every day - whether it’s managing menus and orders, tracking performance, or scaling their business. You’ll work closely with designers, analysts, product leads, and fellow engineers to ensure the app is intuitive, reliable, and scalable as our merchant base rapidly grows.
   

  

 This is a chance to
 **build from scratch** 
 with modern best practices, collaborate with some of the best engineers in the industry. At Wolt, we value autonomy, ownership, and technical excellence. You’ll have the freedom to shape both
 **what** 
 we build and
 **how** 
 we build it - while receiving mentorship, support, and opportunities to grow every step of the way.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Working with senior developers in architecting and building key components of modern Android applications, leveraging both existing technology assets and new tools such as Jetpack Compose, Kotlin Coroutines, applying architecture patterns like MVI or MVVM, experience with Kotlin Multiplatform, and embracing modularization for scalability and maintainability.
* Influence architecture decisions and technology stack selection, and help steer overall product direction.
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend teams to shape features and user experiences.
* Implement high-quality, scalable code while maintaining performance and security standards.
* Rapidly iterate and adapt to evolving requirements and ambiguous contexts.
* Continuously refine the app’s user experience to support and enhance merchants’ daily operations.
* Drive innovation and help to establish best practices for the team.


 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the role will be filled as soon as we find the right person -so don’t wait!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes a conversation with the Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team chat, and a final decision.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Android
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We in the Messaging team** 
 own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.
   

  

**As a Senior Software Engineer Android within the messaging team,** 
 you will play a key role in building and enhancing core messaging features integral to our product. You'll work closely with a talented team of Android engineers, writing high-quality, maintainable code while ensuring optimal performance and user experience. Collaboration is at the heart of this role, as you'll partner with various teams and roles across the company to align with shared objectives and contribute to the broader product vision. By following best practices and upholding high engineering standards, you'll help drive the success of our platform, making a meaningful impact while growing in a dynamic and supportive environment.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, designers, and engineers to build & A/B test new features using Agile methodology.
* Identify & execute large tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
* Take responsibility for setting & maintaining high engineering standards and commitment to building products that meet user needs.
* Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* 8+ years of experience in Android development.
* A strong passion for enhancing user experiences and contributing to product roadmap.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Experience with RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Strong knowledge of version control tools, such as Git.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices, as well as an eye for design.
* Interest in mentoring & coaching others.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!
* Relocation: Ready for a new adventure in Stockholm? We've got you covered! Our comprehensive relocation support package is designed for a seamless transition. We'll assist with your visa and work permits, cover your airfare, help you find a new home, and provide settling-in services to navigate everything from setting up a bank account to registering with local authorities.

title: System Architect with Cyber Security interest
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Join Getinge and strengthen our Product Area Critical Care in Solna as a System Architect. We are now strengthening one of our value creation teams to speed up the software development. You will, together with the team, be responsible for and own the whole product development cycle. The work consists of new development, from concepts and requirements to final product. The team is responsible for core subsystems development related to gas delivery, connectivity, Cyber Security, alarm and monitoring both for new products together with maintenance of our existing products within anesthesia.
   

  

 As a System Architect at Getinge, you will tackle complex interdisciplinary challenges and collaborate with highly skilled colleagues to find innovative solutions. You will contribute to the development of world-leading products in intensive care and anesthesia.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Your primary responsibility as a System Architect is to drive and take part in the system engineering of our products and ensure that they deliver the required system functionality and performance. This includes activities like system design, requirements engineering, and risk management. Strong documentation skills are essential to secure clear scope, right expectations, and formal requirements, to enable efficient collaboration and development. Risk analysis plays a crucial role in addressing challenges and maintaining the highest quality standards.
   

  

**To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualities:**
* Experience as a System Architect, ideally within the medical technology or related regulated field.
* Experience working with Cyber Security
* Comfortable making critical technical decisions, thriving in high-expectation environments.
* Interest in advanced healthcare and our products in intensive care and anesthesiology.
* Customer-centric mindset, collaborating closely with customers and users to understand their needs through user studies and evaluations.
* Effective collaboration within cross-functional teams, including product managers, UX-designers, developers, and testers.
* Thrive when working with safety-critical systems in advanced healthcare, where functionality and reliability are vital.
* Proactive and self-driven in learning and contributing to the continued development of our products and our organizations capabilities.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor or Master of Science in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering, or equivalent.
* 5 years of experience as a System Architect.
* Experience designing/developing complex mechatronic systems with graphical user interface.
* Risk analysis expertise, addressing potential challenges, and maintaining high-quality standards.
* Experience of requirement and test management software
* Experience with product development in a regulated industry, e.g. medical technology or automotive.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.


**Personal Characteristics**
 In addition to technical skills, the following personal attributes will contribute to your success:
   

  

* Analytical and systematic problem-solving approach, capable of handling intricate challenges and breaking down tasks effectively.
* Proactive and assertive, leading technology and driving towards common goals
* Ambition for growth, embracing challenging and stimulating tasks.
* Strong documentation skills


 Become part of Getinge's revolution in healthcare technology. Apply now to embark on a rewarding journey with us.
   

  

**Why join Getinge**
 Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.
   

  

 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible, but no later than October 25th.
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Katarina Dahlén at Katarina.dahlen@getinge.com or Recruiter Sofia Ekstrand at sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: Thesis: Optimizing Cold Start Latency and Resource Scaling in Serverless Platforms for High-Load Applications
description:
**High Level Description**
 When utilizing distributed systems that consists of many different servers or containers, startup of these can oftentimes be very slow and reduce the speed of a whole system. This is especially important in high-load applications where response times are important. As always, the performance must be balanced out with the cost of the system, where a middle ground must be reached between the response times and the cost of the applications.
   

  

 This thesis will investigate optimization techniques to minimize cold start latency and enhance resource scaling efficiency in serverless function platforms, especially under high-load scenarios. The work will focus on dynamic, workload-aware adaptive solutions that improve user experience and operational cost-effectiveness without requiring changes to application code. This research seeks to understand what factors affect the response times and how the system can scale using predictive loads.
   

  

**Project Description**
 This thesis project focuses on investigating and improving the performance of serverless computing platforms in the context of high-load applications. In particular, the work will address two of the most pressing challenges in serverless environments: cold start latency and efficient resource scaling. Cold starts can introduce unpredictable delays in request handling, while scaling inefficiencies can lead to either poor performance during traffic spikes or unnecessary costs during low-traffic periods.
   

  

 The project will include both a theoretical and practical component. On the theoretical side, existing research and industry approaches to mitigating cold starts and scaling issues will be studied. On the practical side, experiments will be conducted to systematically measure and profile cold start latency, identify workload-specific bottlenecks, and evaluate strategies such as pre-warming, workload prediction, caching, and adaptive instance scaling policies. Simulated high-load scenarios will be created to compare different optimization techniques in terms of response times, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
   

  

 The outcome of this project will be a set of insights, benchmarks, and recommendations for optimizing serverless platforms under high-load conditions. Depending on the scope, this could also include a prototype implementation of a workload-aware adaptive scaling solution that integrates with an existing serverless platform. Through this work, the thesis will contribute to bridging the gap between theoretical performance models and practical techniques that can be applied in real-world serverless applications.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We are looking for a student with a strong interest in cloud computing, distributed systems, and serverless architectures. This opportunity is well-suited for students pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field. A solid foundation in distributed systems and cloud-native principles is important, along with curiosity for practical performance optimization. Previous experience with cloud platforms as well as familiarity with serverless would be highly beneficial.
   

  

**Purpose**
 The aim of this project is to investigate how cold start latency be systematically broken down and profiled to identify workload-specific bottlenecks. This thesis aims to investigate practical implementation to advance serverless computing performance and scalability for complex, high-load cloud applications.
   

  

**An Exciting Journey with Knightec Group**
 Semcon and Knightec have joined forces as Knightec Group. Together, we are Northern Europe’s leading strategic partner in product and digital service development. With a unique combination of cross-functional expertise and a holistic business understanding, we help our clients realize their strategies – from idea to complete solution.
   

  

**Practical Information**
 This is a thesis position, located at our office in Solna United, Rättarvägen 3. Start date is 2026-01-20.
   

  

 Please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-11-15. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Julius Jensen. Note that due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers page.

title: Mobile Android Engineer, Consumer Finance Engineering
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for an Android Engineer to join our Consumer Finance Engineering team at Wolt. Our mission is to design, build, and expand consumer facing financial products that integrate seamlessly into the Wolt ecosystem and offer an enhanced experience.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As an Android Engineer in the Consumer Finance team, your role is to implement and contribute to the development of our beautifully designed consumer app. You will be at the forefront of Wolt’s consumer finance experience, building features that impact millions of users by enabling and creating new surfaces in our application.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with our designer, analyst, product lead, and fellow engineers as we balance our efforts to grow our advertisement business at high speed while maintaining engineering excellence. You will be involved in ensuring timely development and releases. You will also have ownership of quality assurance and solidifying our telemetry logic to ensure data accuracy and system reliability.
   

  

 We embrace a hybrid work model. Join us in our beautiful Helsinki office to connect and collaborate with your teammates, or work from home whenever you choose.
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* Understand the intention of what we are building and why
* With the help of more seasoned engineers, work on assigned tasks ensuring timely delivery
* Bring new ideas to the table to discuss with the team
* Constantly learn new things and up-skill
* You’ll be surrounded by experienced developers who will challenge you, mentor you, and give you the tools to accelerate your growth. If you’re ambitious, open-minded, and excited about building products that people love to use, this is the opportunity to start shaping your career.
* Your role will require an ability to handle ambiguity and rapid changes while maintaining a focus on quality and high performance. This is a unique opportunity to work on new products that will significantly impact how Merchants operate with Wolt.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Working with more senior developers in architecting and building key components of modern Android applications, leveraging both existing technology assets and new tools such as Kotlin, coroutines and Flow for concurrency, unit testing, familiarity with MVVM and other design patterns and understanding of UI frameworks such as Jetpack Compose and the traditional View system.
* Influence architecture decisions and technology stack selection, and help steer overall product direction.
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend teams to shape features and user experiences.
* Implement high-quality, scalable code while maintaining performance and security standards.
* Rapidly iterate and adapt to evolving requirements and ambiguous contexts.
* Continuously refine the app’s user experience to support and enhance customers’ experience.
* GitHub, CI/CD, and test automation skills (unit, integration, e2e)
* Be able to understand and execute project plans on schedule


 We value developers who can own projects, embrace modern Android technologies, write testable, maintainable code, and collaborate across teams. You should be comfortable with both greenfield and legacy projects, understand the product lifecycle, and balance scalability with customer value.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 This will be a high impact team developing consumer finance products for Wolt customers. The products have a very large user base spanning 31 countries and every decision that we make affects almost everyone. We make almost all decisions as a team and encourage all ideas and suggestions. The best part of the role is that you can physically see your products in action on the Wolt Consumer app which would be used by our customers on a daily basis.
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so apply as soon as you realize you’d love to join us!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes an initial chat with our Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team conversation, and final alignment.
   

  

 For questions, feel free to contact Aakaanksha Pandey, Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner, at aakaanksha.pandey@wolt.com.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Anaplan Solution Architect
description:
Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.
   

  

 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced
 **Anaplan Solution Architect** 
 to join our
 **Anaplan Delivery** 
 team in Europe.
   

  

**The role**
 The Anaplan Solution Architect will design best-in-class Anaplan solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of our clients. You will develop and cast the technical vision to internal model-building consultants, and most importantly, to our clients, as we work to deliver the best possible solution to their challenges. Your design will account for data sources, integration layers, the underlying Anaplan model architecture, and the user interface, and you will have the opportunity to coach and train others along the way!
   

  

* Work as a Solutions Architect and lead the end-to-end design of an Anaplan Model
* Run a project utilising the Agile Implementation Methodology
* Teach both clients and internal teams with no prior Anaplan knowledge how to build a model.
* Guide a customer to enhance their process utilising both Anaplan expertise and Subject Matter Expertise.
* Have difficult conversations with a customer about scope and timeline to ensure the project timeline is on track and the budget
* Effectively lead a team of consultants


**You have:**
* Sound experience in Consulting or Financial Reporting, and Analysis
* Strong knowledge of Excel. Including an understanding of how to develop macros, and model large data sets utilising Lookups and SumIf functions.
* Microsoft Office Suite expertise
* Strong understanding of Multi-Dimensional data architecture and data integration
* Previous experience with other EPM technologies


**We take care of you!**
 As an employee of Spaulding Ridge, you will be part of a company that provides innovative opportunities to impact our clients in a meaningful way positively. We believe giving back is core to our values and as part of this effort, you will be given the opportunity to participate in different opportunities throughout the year, including SR’s day of service, giving back to our global community.
   

  

**Please note we are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role.**
**Spaulding Ridge’s Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace**
 When we engage the expertise, insights, and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.
   

  

 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected, and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support inclusion, and through our employee led Employee Resource Groups (ERGs): CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, PROUD and Mental Wellness Alliance.
   

  

 The company is committed to offering Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay (challaday@spauldingridge.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

title: Tekniksystemledare för Satellitkommunikationssystem
description:
**Vill du också arbeta i en miljö där du blir en viktig länk i en samhällsviktig verksamhet? Vill du** **påverka och bidra till Sveriges säkerhet och att vi kan fortsätta leva i ett demokratiskt land? I** **Försvarsmakten gör alla våra medarbetare skillnad för Sverige varje dag.**


**Om enheten**  

Teknik- och vidmakthållandekontor Ledningssystem (TVK Ledsyst) har sin huvudverksamhet förlagd på Ledningsregementet i Enköping och funktionsleds av Försvarsmaktens Högkvarter. Enhetens huvudsakliga uppgift är att ta ansvar för Försvarsmaktens ledningsstödsystem under hela livscykeln, från kravställning till avveckling, under såväl fred, kris och krig.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**  

Som Tekniksystemledare har du en central roll i förvaltningen av tilldelade tekniska system. Du är central aktör i den långsiktiga planeringen av systemens livscykel. Tjänsten innebär att du inledningsvis skall delta i utveckling och förankring av centrala förvaltningsrutiner inom satkomområdet. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan med berörda över-, under- och sidoordnade aktörer. I tjänsten kommer du att leda och delta i möten med användare, krigsorganisation, underhålls- och förvaltningspersonal samt representanter för FMV, industrin samt andra totalförsvarsaktörer. I tjänsten kan ytterligare system/delsystem tillkomma.


Du ingår i en sektion om 5-10 medarbetare och kommer att vara placerad i Enköping, om inte annat överenskommits. Arbete kommer även att ske på annan ort, exempelvis vid anläggnings- och verksamhetsbesök. Delar av förvaltningsarbetet sker gemensamt inom sektionens ramar, exempelvis vid uppföljning och rapportering. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär att du behöver teknisk förståelse, god administrativ förmåga samt en förmåga att överblicka systemens hela livscykel. Du bör ha god förmåga att sammanfatta och dra slutsatser ur komplexa sammanhang liksom kunna arbeta även med bristfälliga beslutsunderlag.


Som tekniksystemledare skall du:


* Säkerställa att system och materiel som tas emot från leverantören är förvaltningsbara.
* Leda mottagning av system från leverantörer till Försvarsmakten.
* Leda planering, genomförande, uppföljning och rapportering av systemstatus, drift och underhåll.
* Leda krigsplacering av materiel till krigsförbanden.
* Leda granskning och revision av teknisk dokumentation.
* Säkerställa att det finns erforderliga utbildningar för drift- och underhållsorganisationen.
* Aktivt arbeta med ständiga förbättringar av verksamheten.


**KRAV**  

**Kvalifikationer**


* Akademisk utbildning inom teknik/it/systemvetenskap eller erfarenheter som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdiga.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltningsarbete med satellitbaserade transmissionssystem.
* God förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
* B-körkort.


**Personliga egenskaper**  

Du är en person som tar ansvar och är pådrivande i dina arbetsuppgifter. Du kan arbeta strukturerat och självständigt och räds inte att fatta beslut när så krävs i syfte att leda och driva arbetet framåt. Du är stresstålig och har förmåga att prioritera samt har god analytisk förmåga. Du kan samarbeta med andra och är social och prestigelös, egenskaper som krävs då arbetet kräver nära samverkan med andra organisationsenheter och myndigheter.  

Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


**MERITERANDE**


* Erfarenhet av försvarsindustrin, FM, FMV eller annan statlig myndighet samt internationella samarbeten inom satkomområdet.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltningsarbete med sensor- och/eller radiosystem.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av system i stora organisationer.
* Erfarenhet och kunskap om IT-säkerhet och informationssäkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning.


**Övrigt**  

Anställningsform: Tillsvidare. Försvarsmakten tillämpar sex månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd i myndigheten.  

Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid.  

Arbetsort: Enköping, om inte annat överenskommits. Resor förekommer till andra orter.  

Civil befattning.  

Tillträdesdatum: Enligt överenskommelse.


**Upplysningar om befattningen**  

Sektionschef Carl Nauclér, nås via växeln 010-825 70 00.


**Information om rekryteringsprocessen**  

Personaladministratör Lina Nilsson, nås via växeln 010-825 70 00.


**Fackliga företrädare**


* Saco-S – Ann-Marie Löfwenberg
* SEKO – Benny Augustsson
* OFR/S – Clarence Arnstedt
* OFR/O, OF Enköping – Mikael Eriksson


Samtliga nås via växeln 010-825 70 00


**Ansökan**  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-11-03. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV och**  

**ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning samt svar på angivna**  

**urvalsfrågor.**

title: IT Solution Specialist / IT System Maintenance
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Monitor system health, data quality, and performance, through Profisee reports.
* Operational governance with vendor Profisee.
* Provide expert support and training for users of the Profisee MDM platform.
* Act as a subject matter expert for master data management best practices.
* Understand data flow to consuming applications and secure changes.
* Manage, administrate, and support users in Profisee.
* Secure necessary end-user support processes.


**Requirements**


* Solid understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) concepts and platforms (Profisee etc.).
* Experience with Master Data Management concepts, data modeling, and data governance.
* Process-oriented mindset with experience in documenting and optimizing workflows.
* Configure Profisee platform components, collaborate on technical setup, and support integration
* Develop and execute technical test cases, assist with data migration, and validate mappings.
* Provide post-go-live technical support, troubleshooting integration issues, and monitor system performance
* Experience in supporting and training users.
* Agile methodologies; SAFe, Scrum.
* Experience with system monitoring tools and reporting on data quality metrics.
* Hands-on experience configuring MDM platforms (Profisee experience is a plus, but other MDM tools like Informatica, Semarchy, or Stibo are valuable).

title: Systemadministratör Linux
description:
**Vill du förvalta och utveckla Linuxplattformen som bär upp SMHI:s samhällsviktiga system? Hos oss får du ett brett och meningsfullt uppdrag tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor – och stor möjlighet att påverka hur vi automatiserar och driver vår miljö framåt.**


**Om IT-verksamheten**  

Vi uppnår en välfungerande IT-verksamhet genom att tillhandahålla användarvänliga, kostnadseffektiva och ändamålsenliga IT-tjänster och verktyg. IT-avdelningen består av ca 130 personer fördelade på fyra enheter: Arkitektur, Digitala arbetsplatsen, Systemutveckling och IT-produktion. Enheten för IT-produktion har en central roll i att forma och tillhandahålla den tekniska grunden för SMHI:s IT-miljö.


**Om tjänsten**



Du blir en del av gruppen Infrastruktur Server inom enheten IT Produktion, med ansvar för operativsystem på server och klient, automatisering, databaser samt identitet och behörighet. Tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor förvaltar och utvecklar du vår Linux klient- och serverplattform (i dag Red Hat Enterprise Linux), en viktig del av vår komplexa och spännande IT-miljö. Vi jobbar aktivt med automatisering av vår plattform för att frigöra tid, effektivisera och skapa redundans. I grupperingen finns även ansvar för remote desktop, printserver, mailgateway och FTP-tjänst.



Du ger kontorsnära support för Linuxmiljön, inklusive klienter, och ingår i en roterande supportvecka dagtid, ungefär var femte vecka. Du samarbetar tätt med övriga grupperingar inom IT-produktion, i synnerhet systergrupperingen Infrastruktur Bas, har frekvent dialog med användare och utvecklingsverksamheten, och bidrar i pågående teknikskiften såsom nätverkssegmentering och containerisering. Tillsammans med dina närmaste kollegor planerar, prioriterar och genomför du arbetet och blir del av ett tajt och kompetent team som stöttar varandra för att driva ständiga förbättringar.



Har du kompetens och intresse i andra teknikområden inom IT-infrastruktur finns goda möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas inom enheten.



Anställningen innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Svenskt medborgarskap och godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) är en förutsättning för anställning.


**Om dig**



Vi söker dig som har eftergymnasial IT-utbildning om minst två år eller motsvarande erfarenhet. Du uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift, och har goda kunskaper inom IT-infrastruktur och Linux – både server och klient. Du har minst två års systemadministrativ erfarenhet inom infrastruktur och Linux, både server och klient i en större miljö.


**Starkt meriterande**


* Utbildning, eller motsvarande erfarenhet och/eller certifieringar inom teknikområdet Linux, gärna RHEL.
* Fördjupad erfarenhet av Linux/RHEL (server/klient), inklusive hårdvaruinstallation, plattformsansvar/managering och strategiskt arbete med helhetssyn på IT-infrastruktur
* Erfarenhet av stödverktyg som Puppet (OpenVox), Foreman och integration mot virtualiseringsplattform (t.ex. VMware vSphere)
* Automatisering genom exempelvis AWX/Ansible


**Meriterande**


* Fördjupning inom IT-infrastruktur exempelvis inom automatisering, nätverk och/eller containerteknik.
* Kompetens inom IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av miljöer anpassade för att skydda säkerhetsklassad information
* Versionshantering (t.ex. GitLab)
* Skript/programmering (t.ex. Python)


**Dina personliga egenskaper och förmågor** är viktiga för att trivas och lyckas i uppdraget. Vi söker dig med ett stort eget driv och uthållighet; du förblir motiverad och effektiv när hinder uppstår och du har en stark lojalitetskänsla till uppdraget och dina kollegor. Du är van att ta ansvar för även om man jobbar i nära samarbete med dina kollegor ligger ett stort personligt ansvar på att driva och förvalta de områden som man är ansvarig för.



Du driver din egen personliga utveckling i arbetet och motiveras av att få jobba med kvalificerade kollegor i en spännande miljö. Du har ett bra mått av servicekänsla och är lyhörd för användarönskemål utan att göra avkall på noggrannhet och effektivitet. Du har en utvecklad säkerhetsmedvetenhet utifrån ditt teknikområde.


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidareanställning


**Placeringsort:** Norrköping.


**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2025-11-16


Läs mer om SMHI som arbetsplats och om vårt erbjudande här.  

  

SMHI är en svensk expertmyndighet med globalt perspektiv och en livsviktig uppgift i att förutse förändringar i väder, vatten och klimat. Med vetenskaplig grund och genom kunskap, forskning och tjänster bidrar vi till att öka hela samhällets hållbarhet. Varje dag, dygnet runt, året om.  

  

SMHI är en beredskapsmyndighet och som anställd kan du komma att krigsplaceras vid myndigheten.  

  

Tänk på att de handlingar och uppgifter du skickar till SMHI genom din ansökan blir en allmän handling. Detta betyder att allt material i ansökan, inklusive bilagor, kan behöva lämnas ut till den som begär det om uppgifterna inte omfattas av sekretess enligt offentlighets- och sekretesslagen. Tänk på att i första hand skriva det som du bedömer är relevant i förhållande till kraven på tjänsten. Tänk på din integritet och undvik att lämna information som innehåller känsliga personuppgifter, uppgifter om din eller närståendes hälsa, politiska åsikter eller religiös övertygelse.

title: Office 365 Specialist to Sweco IT
description:
**Office 365 Specialist to Sweco IT**
=====================================


The Office 365 Management Team at Sweco IT is seeking a passionate Office 365 Specialist with a strong interest in Identity and Access Management solutions. This role offers a dynamic work environment where you will contribute to innovative projects, implement new solutions, and provide expert advice in strategic planning.


You will belong to the Infrastructure & Cloud unit at Sweco IT and report to the Team Manager for Office 365 Management. Our team consists of specialists in Identity, Collaboration, and Email/Messaging, spread across five European countries. With the rapid adoption of O365 at Sweco, there are abundant opportunities to drive change and pioneer new technologies.

**Role Responsibilities:**  

In the role of Office 365 Specialist you will work in our Office 365 Management team based in our Stockholm Office. In your daily work you will research and implement new solutions, be involved with ongoing projects, handle requests for new services, and be an advisor in strategic planning whilst working closely with the wider Sweco business.


You will work proactively with developing and improving processes, solving problems, and developing documentation. You will be a ‘go to’ person for technical advice and information both within Sweco IT and in the business.

**Key Qualifications:**

* A minimum of 3 years’ relevant experience and solid understanding of technical concepts.
* Solid technical background with strong knowledge of Office 365 services and technologies, including Entra ID.
* Experience in O365 migration work in a large organization is advantageous but not essential.
* Proactive in developing and improving processes, solving problems, and creating documentation.
* Excellent communication skills in English, for providing technical advice and information within Sweco IT and the wider business.

**Technical Skills and Experience:**

***Entra / Azure / O365:***

* User and group management.
* Application and permission management, Role-Based Access Control.
* SSO configurations, SAML, and oAuth authentication.
* Conditional Access and MFA configuration.
* Working knowledge of GraphAPI (using Entra and permission management).
* Knowledge of Active Directory and Entra ID Connect.
* Experience in Powershell scripting and SQL (desirable).
* Subscription and resource management in Azure (desirable).

***Microsoft 365:***

* Understand the Microsoft 365 Roadmap and proactively identify, research, and implement beneficial features.
* Troubleshoot, configure, and maintain O365 core services.
* Collaborate with Sweco Enterprise Architects on large organizational projects.
* Advise on applications and services within Office 365, demonstrating and documenting opportunities and limitations.
* Handle incidents and work with external suppliers and stakeholders.

**About you:**  

As a person, you are driven, proactive, like to work at a fast pace and find it fun to solve problems. You have an ability to think both short-term and long-term and are passionate about delivering positive results. You are also self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to come up with practical solutions to problems. Finally, you adhere to our core behaviours: approachability, commitment, and expertise.


**Why join Sweco?**

* Professional development opportunities and various training opportunities.
* A pleasant and dynamic working atmosphere in a growing and leading company.
* An industry that is going through a major shift in way of working
* A culture that values inclusion, innovation, and continuous learning

**Application:**  

We review applications ongoing so do not wait to submit you application if you are interested in this position. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact us. We will get back to all applicants after the recruitment process has been completed.


At Sweco, we strive to be a workplace characterized by diversity. We believe that more perspectives broaden our ability to continue to achieve our goals and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


Do you want to be part of shaping the future? Then we look forward to receiving your application!

**Contact Us:**  

If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Tom Mortimer, Team Manager O365 Management.


Background checks will be carried out on the final candidate as part of this recruitment process.

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our customers, our 23,000 architects, engineers and other experts develop solutions to manage urbanization, take advantage of the opportunities of digitalization and make the societies of the future more sustainable. Sweco is the leading consulting company in technology and architecture in Europe with a turnover of approximately SEK 29 billion. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For further information,* *http://www.sweco.se*
company_description: Sweco planerar och utformar framtidens samhällen och städer.

**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------

Enköpings kommun är arbetsplatsen för dig som vill vara med och skapa det långsiktigt goda samhället. Här får du möjlighet till personlig utveckling samtidigt som du får chansen att göra verklig skillnad för alla som lever och verkar i Enköping. Vi förutsätter att du är kompetent, vetgirig och redo att axla ett stort ansvar. Vilka goda idéer vill du vara med och förverkliga?  

  

Vill du veta mer om Enköpings kommun som arbetsgivare? Titta in på vår jobb- och karriärwebb: https://enkoping.se/jobb


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

Rollen som utbildningsledare är en agil projektledarroll med ansvar för utveckling, kvalitetssäkring och drift av YH-program och YH-kurser inom Data/IT och IT-säkerhet. Du ansvarar för våra två klasser inom IT-säkerhet med fokus på planering, schemaläggning, konsultavtal och teknikfrågor.  

  

Du är tillsammans med chef och specialister delansvarig för ansökningar om att få bedriva YH-program och YH-kurser inom det aktuella området. Du har ansvar för såväl individuella studerandefrågor som för kontakter med ledningsgruppen, LIA-företagen, rekryterande organisationer, branschorganisationer och externa partners. Tillsammans med vårt YH-team ansvarar du för rapportering och kontakter med myndigheter och externa intressenter.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

Erfarenhet att planera, starta och driva YH-utbildningar  

  

Du har flerårig dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ansöka, utveckla, planera, driva och kvalitetssäkra YH-program och YH-kurser inom Data/IT, webb eller IT-säkerhet.  

  

Eftergymnasial examen inom Data/IT, webb eller IT-säkerhet  

  

Du har examen på nivå 5 och uppåt enligt SEQF gällande IT-området.  

  

Ledarskap och teamledning  

  

Du har erfarenhet som projektledare och teamledning inom yrkeshögskolan och inom Data/IT, webb eller IT-säkerhet.  

  

Du är en förebild som leder, motiverar och delegerar för att effektivt nå gemensamma mål. Du har förmåga att skapa engagemang och delaktighet.  

  

Du arbetar mot mål och fokuserar på resultat. Du planerar och prioriterar ditt agerande utifrån målen. När målen ändras har du förmåga att förändra din inriktning.  

  

Du är självgående och tar ansvar för din uppgift. Du strukturerar och driver ditt arbete självständigt.  

  

Du är lugn, stabil och kontrollerad i pressade eller utmanande situationer. Du behåller ett sansat perspektiv på situationer och fokuserar på rätt saker.  

  

Du har empatisk förmåga och kan sätta dig in i någon annans perspektiv eller situation utan att ta över personens känslor.


**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------

Tillträde: 2026-02-01
Tillträde per 1 februari 2026 eller tidigare enligt överenskommelse

-----------

**Övrigt**
----------

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! I vissa rekryteringar arbetar vi med löpande urval och du kan därför komma att höra ifrån oss innan angiven sista ansökningsdag.  

  

För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen samt möjliggöra god kommunikation med våra sökande ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan digitalt via länken för ansökan.

Vill du veta var vi finns?

title: Data Engineer - Tietoevry Create
description:
Job Description  

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join Tietoevry Create. The role focuses on designing and implementing scalable data pipelines and cloud-based solutions in Azure, with a strong emphasis on IoT, analytics, and modern data platforms. As a consultant, you’ll be part of a team that works closely with customers and internal stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that drive real business value. Geographical location for this role is mainly Malmö.


We believe that our organizational culture is key to enabling your success. You’ll be part of a collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning and innovation. The role offers varied challenges and technologies, giving you the opportunity to grow and broaden your expertise.

**When joining Tietoevry Create as a Data Engineer:**

* You will design and build data pipelines and cloud-native solutions in Azure.
* Work with technologies such as Microsoft Fabric, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Power BI, Event Hubs, and Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with internal teams and customers to implement secure, scalable, and cost-efficient solutions.
* Ensure best practices in architecture, monitoring, and DevOps.

**Who we are looking for:**

* Experience in data engineering and cloud development, preferably in Microsoft Azure.
* You don’t need to master everything listed, but you should have solid experience in **some** of the following areas:


	+ **Data Ingestion & Processing**: Azure Event Hubs, Stream Analytics.
	+ **Serverless Compute**: Azure Functions.
	+ **Data Persistence**: Cosmos DB (partitioning, performance tuning).
	+ **Analytics & Warehousing**: Synapse Analytics, Delta Lake, Databricks, Microsoft Fabric.
	+ **Visualization & Reporting**: Power BI.
	+ **Cloud Architecture**: Scalable, secure design patterns.
	+ **DevOps & Monitoring**: Azure DevOps, CI/CD, Azure Monitor, Application Insights
* You are proactive, detail-oriented, and enjoy working with responsibility and influence

**We offer:** We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, and an open culture with outstanding work-life balance. You’ll be part of a growing and fast-developing sector, with a flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on continuous learning.

**Did we get you inspired?**


We look forward to your application!  

Please attach your CV or LinkedIn profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Emma Rosenkvist, emma.rosenkvist@tietoevry.com


Hope to hear from you soon!


Location: Malmö. The position does not involve extensive travel, but some travel activities are expected.  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*  

*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*  

*Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.*

  

Additional Information  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.


Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)
