title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.

  

Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 41,000+ GitHub Stars.

  

At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.

  

By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.

  

At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data

### **What would you do at Prisma?**


We anticipate you to be responsible for:

* **People:** Empower your engineering team to achieve technical excellence and meaningful impact by ensuring they have the support and resources to do their best work. This includes providing constructive feedback, creating learning and growth opportunities, and challenging them to improve. Help them understand why their work matters and how it aligns with company-wide KPIs. We believe that strong, healthy teams start with investing in people.
* **Process:** Optimize and refine development processes and technical practices to drive continuous improvement. We believe in relentless optimization—if something can be done better, we find a way. You will lead engineering team meetings to plan and prioritize work, run retrospectives to identify improvements, and establish policies that enhance communication, collaboration, and code quality.
* **Delivery:** Success for your team means consistently delivering high-quality software that provides value while maintaining a sustainable pace. You will collaborate closely with the Product Manager to prioritize product initiatives, define the roadmap, and drive technical improvements.

### **An Ideal Candidate Profile**


We believe the right candidate for this position should meet a majority of the criteria listed below.

* **8+ Years proven leadership** in software engineering teams, with hands-on experience as a software engineer. Specifically a strong understanding of
* **Experience in database and backend technologies**, including TypeScript, SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, MongoDB, SQL Server), and familiarity with cloud services, APIs (GraphQL/REST), and developer tooling is a plus.
* **High standards for quality**, ensuring excellence while balancing **pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency**—taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* Focused on helping your team **understand the** ***why.***
* **Strong communication skills in English**, both written and verbal—able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, **give and receive constructive feedback effectively**, and foster collaboration across teams.
* **You have a structured thought process**, approaching problems methodically and making well-reasoned decisions. **You plan effectively**, setting clear goals, anticipating challenges, and ensuring smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.

### **What's it like to work at Prisma?**


You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...

* **... have an ownership mindset.** As an Engineering Manager, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* **... stay nimble.** It's a startup, things change and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* **... be kind and collaborative.** Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.

### **What's in it for you?**


We put our people first. Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.

* An opportunity to **lead the team shaping Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products**, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications — see what we’re building.
* **A Fun and Supportive Team** that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* **Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options**, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* **Fully Remote Work** with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* **Generous Time Off**, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* **Parental Benefits**, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* **Sabbatical Leave**, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* **Mental Health Support**, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* **Tech budge** to equip you with the tools you need.
* **Annual Off-sites**, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* **Relocation Support**, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* **[US] Health and Pension Benefits**, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.

### **Remote Work**


To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone **GMT -2 to GMT +3** for this position.

### **What is our hiring process like?**

* **Introductory Call** with our Head of Engineering
* **Take Home Assignment** where you will share some of your thoughts and approaches to management.
* **Team Interview** with some of the engineers that form part of your team.
* **Leadership Interview** with our COO.
* **Final Interview** \*\*with our CEO.
* **Offer**


The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.

  

If you believe that this is the right position for you then please send your resume along with any supporting documentation or information to us via the link provided on this page. We typically respond within 7 business days.


In line with our *Fair Treatment and Equal Opportunity Policy*, as well as our *Disability Policy*, Prisma follows fair and merit-based hiring practices, ensuring all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, experience, and qualifications. We do not make hiring decisions based on *age*, *race*, *ethnicity, sex, gender identity, parental or caregiver status, trade union membership, disability, religious belief or lack of belief, life expectancy, sexual orientation, genetic information*, or *veteran or military status.*

title: Customer Success Executive
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**  

The **Customer Success Executive** is accountable for the strategic leadership and execution of post-sales activities within our most valuable accounts. This position plays a crucial role in driving ServiceNow’s long-term value by accelerating customers’ journey to success, ensuring predictable renewals, and maximizing the impact of ServiceNow across their business transformation initiatives.


As a trusted advisor, you’ll partner with C-level executives, guide seamless delivery of business transformation, and foster collaboration with ServiceNow’s teams and strategic partners.

**What You Get to Do in This Role:**

* **Drive Post-Sales Success**: Own and lead the customer’s post-sales transformation, aligning ServiceNow’s offerings to customer goals, and bringing relevant industry thought-leadership to the table. Foster strong relationships with C-Level executives to deliver on business outcomes.
* **Collaborate Strategically**: Partner with Account Executives to create and execute integrated pre- and post-sales strategies, delivering long-term value for both the customer and ServiceNow. Leverage the right resources at the right time to ensure success.
* **Mitigate Risks and Drive Value**: Proactively identify potential risks to success and work with the customer and internal teams to develop strategies to overcome them, ensuring a smooth path toward value realization.
* **Focus on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)**: Guide and inspire the Customer Success team to meet critical operational KPIs—adoption, technical health, renewals, customer satisfaction, and expansion. Work closely with customers to align their roadmap and drive new revenue opportunities.
* **Foster Strategic Alignment**: Build relationships with ServiceNow leaders and consistently incorporate customer feedback to drive continuous improvement. Align business transformation insights with organizational goals to ensure long-term success.
* **Advocate for Innovation and Continuous Learning**: As a strategic thought leader, drive innovative solutions for our customers, always looking for opportunities to help them achieve their long-term goals. Foster a culture of agility and calculated risk-taking within the team.
* **Set Success Metrics and Milestones**: Establish clear, measurable success metrics with the customer, and regularly review progress. Refine business transformation plans as needed to ensure milestones are met and value is realized

 **Qualifications**  

We are seeking a highly experienced professional with a strong background in **enterprise-level SaaS transformation and strategic advisory** to guide our customers in their digital transformation journey. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in technology-enabled business transformations, coupled with a proven ability to advise at the executive level.

**Key Requirements:**

* **AI Integration & Thought Leadership:** Experience leveraging AI to enhance work processes, decision-making, and problem-solving, including AI-powered automation, workflow optimization, and data-driven insights
* **Enterprise SaaS Transformation & Strategic Advisory:** Extensive experience leading large-scale digital transformations within SaaS or enterprise software environments.
* **C-Level Presence & Relationship Management:** Proven ability to engage, influence, and build lasting relationships with senior executives, including within some of the world’s largest enterprises..
* **Leadership Expertise:** A minimum of **15 years** in management consulting, solution consulting, or a leadership role at a top-tier consulting firm, with a strong track record of exceeding business objectives.
* **Strategic Account Management:** Demonstrated success in leading high-impact customer success or consulting teams and managing complex, strategic accounts.
* **Business Acumen & Problem-Solving:** Ability to identify, analyze, and solve complex business challenges while aligning technology solutions with customer objectives.
* **Cross-Functional Leadership:** Strong experience working across multiple departments, driving alignment, and managing stakeholders in large, matrixed organizations.
* **Adaptability & Change Management:** Ability to navigate dynamic environments, adjusting strategies to meet evolving customer and business needs.
* **Operational & Execution Excellence:** Skilled at designing and implementing scalable, repeatable processes while maintaining a hands-on approach to drive successful execution.
* **Collaboration & Communication:** Exceptional ability to communicate complex ideas clearly, foster collaboration across teams, and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* **Customer-Centric Mindset:** Deep understanding of customer challenges, needs, and motivations, with a focus on delivering value-driven solutions and ensuring long-term success.


This role is ideal for a **seasoned strategic advisor** who thrives in high-impact environments and has the expertise to guide enterprise customers through digital transformation at scale.

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Senior Application Support Consultant
description:
**Company Description**  

We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.


Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.

 **Job Description** **ERP Support Consultant – Unit4 ERP Core & Finance**

**About the Role**


Unit4 is looking for an experienced Application ERP Support Consultant to join our Customer Support team. As an Application Support Consultant, you are the first point of contact for our customers on IT and Business Application related questions for our solutions. In this role, you will provide expert guidance and support for **Unit4 ERP Core**, with a strong focus on finance modules and technical understanding. You’ll be a key contact for our customers, helping them resolve issues and optimize their use of the system. **This role requires on-site presence once a week.**

**Responsibilities**

* Deliver high-quality support for **Unit4 ERP Core**, especially within finance and accounting.
* Troubleshoot and analyze both technical and functional issues. This involves investigate, process and document application issue.
* Collaborate with developers, consultants, and product owners to improve system functionality.
* Document solutions and contribute to our internal knowledge base.
* Participate in improvement initiatives and customer dialogues.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Minimum **3 years of experience** working with **ERP** systems in finance.
* Understanding of **Unit4 ERP Core** functionalities is a strong plus.
* Excellent communication skills, fluent in both **English and Swedish** (spoken and written).
* Exhibits good analytical and problem-solving abilities.

  

**Additional Information**  

Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities.

**Grow with us**


At Unit4, we offer:

* A culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;
* Balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities, and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;
* Talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;
* A commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;
* A safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**


As an Analytics Engineer, you will join the central Analytics Engineering team. Your mission is to provide the tools, solutions, and datasets that enable the company to stay ever more data-informed by bridging the gap between product development and data analytics.


You will play a vital role in ingesting data from our data lake into the data warehouse, where it will be transformed, scheduled, and made ready for use by analytics and product development teams. Our modern data stack runs on Google Cloud Platform, including BigQuery as a data warehouse, Google Cloud Composer (Airflow) for orchestration, and dbt for data transformation. This is a chance to join an organization with passionate Data Scientists and Engineers at an early stage of building a data analytics platform that scales worldwide.

**Your key responsibilities include:**

* Design, build, and maintain the Epidemic data models.
* Drive data architecture matters, ensuring that everything from tracking to reporting cubes adheres to Epidemic’s best practices.
* Act as a stakeholder and partner with both engineering and analytics teams to deliver well-defined, tested, and high-quality data sets.
* Work with business stakeholders and design data models to quantitatively support everything from corporate strategy to user acquisition.
* Support and mentor analytics consumers on best software engineering practices and share learnings across the organization.


**Requirements**

* Experience with data modeling in a modern data environment (such as BigQuery or Snowflake)
* Strong communication skills
* Experience translating business requirements into robust data models
* Experience in SQL and Python.
* A love for teamwork, continuous improvement, and sharing knowledge.
* Follow best software engineering practices in your work.
* Professional working proficiency in English.


**Nice to have**

* Experience with dbt or previous experience working with or setting up ELT-like data pipelines.
* Experience with any of the following tooling: Terraform, Snowplow, Apache Airflow, Looker.
* Experience with cloud computing such as GCP or AWS.


**Equal opportunity employer**  

We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.


**Application**  

Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.


Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI. Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.

title: Technical Test Coordinator
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

  

  

As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, crafting the future of technology. This is a place where you're encouraged to be your own magnificently outstanding self and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.

 **Our Exciting Opportunity!**  

Core Network Solutions, part of Ericsson Cloud Common & Solutions Development Unit (PDU CLCS), is now looking for an ambitious and creative Technical Test Coordinator (TTC) with telecom business experience, wanting to further learn and grow together with us.

  

As TTC, you will work in 5GC E2E Quality Assurance(QA) Program.  

The QA program is responsible for quality assurance of 5GC (CNFs) and cloud products (CNIS) via performing network-level integration and verification (E2E test).

  

You will work closely with a larger team whose members are based in other regions of Sweden and abroad.

  

Our office is located in the scenic and vibrant Lindholmen area in the central parts of Gothenburg, just on the shore of the Göta Älv river.

 **What you will do:**

* Ensure the proper quality assurance with effective test scope and efficient test policies
* Be accountable for the “test quality” and be owner of "test scope", by reviewing test analysis and release need as well as coordinating test activities both inside and outside the respective Program setup
* Collaborate with different parties (e.g. requirements/system manager, product development, QA teams) and other stakeholders to achieve the best product quality
* Be part of the Solutions TTC community, developing, improving, communicating and supporting deployment of the solution-level test strategy
* Drive changes in the test method, test management and test process/wow during the transformation to automate and adopt AI

 **The Skills You Bring:**  

* Love testing and have a strong belief in the importance of quality assurance
* Have the focus and ambition to understand customer needs and can transfer that to practical work and improvements
* Have the talent to see the big picture, challenge current methods, and define the future and vision of how we test our product
* Be used to take the lead in discussions regarding scope, activities and strategies related to test
* Want to continuously develop your knowledge through experience as well as learning, collaboration, and sharing knowledge with others
* Feel natural about mentoring teams on how to achieve the vital needs
* Have a passion to continuously improve the test way of working
  

**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field
* Proven expertise in 5G Core products and functions, network architecture
* Strong knowledge of Cloud Native Architecture, including microservices and containerization technologies
* Excellent problem-solving abilities, ensuring data-driven decisions and navigation through complex technical challenges.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, effectively coordinating cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Hands-on experience with testing methodologies and CI/CD pipelines, especially with load testing
* Python programming is a plus
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken
**Application:**
----------------



We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV/resume in English.  

**Application deadline**: 14th of November 2025  

**Location:** Gothenburg, Sweden  

**Work setup:** We aim for approximately 60% on-site presence at our office.


Please note that we do not accept or process applications submitted via email.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Göteborg

**Req ID:** 774456

title: Technical Support Engineer - BESS / EV Charger (m/w/d)
description:
**Driven by Intelligence. Powered for the Future.** 




  





 Autel is a global tech innovator in automotive diagnostics and smart mobility. With 2,000+ talents across 70+ countries, we fuse AI, big data, and cloud to drive the next generation of intelligent vehicles.
 



  





 As Autel Energy expands rapidly in Europe’s EV charging market, we are seeking a proactive and structured Technical Support Engineer to support our growing operations in Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden.
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 Autel France is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Technical Support Engineer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth delivery of EV chargers and customized energy products to key clients across Europe.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Provide remote and on-site technical support for BESS installations, diagnose and resolve technical issues related to Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS).
* Responsible for the industrial development and system design of BESS.
* Define and coordinate the architecture of the BESS system, including the design of solutions for PCS (Power Conversion System), BMS (Battery Management System), EMS (Energy Management System), BAT (Battery Technology), and electrical and structural components.
* Record support cases, root cause analyses, and solutions in the company’s CRM system, conduct system performance reviews, and recommend optimization strategies.
* Promptly address technical issues reported by customers, track technical problems and perform root cause analysis and corrective actions; gather customer requirements and communicate effectively with the headquarters' R&D department.
* Create and provide technical documentation and training materials; compile maintenance case studies.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy, Power, Telecommunications, Electronics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Over 3 years of work experience in energy storage, renewable energy, solar PV, or power systems.
* Hands-on experience with lithium-ion batteries, inverters, or grid-tied systems.
* Willingness to travel frequently for on-site customer visits.
* Strong organizational skills, execution ability, good stress management, and team-oriented.
* Strong learning ability, service orientation, sense of responsibility, meticulous and rigorous work attitude. Strong self-motivation.
* Fluency in English; proficiency in other European languages is a plus.



  





**Why Join Autel** 



* Key operational role in shaping EV charging infrastructure in the DACH market
* Flat hierarchy with direct access to decision-makers
* Competitive salary with performance-based bonus
* International environment with high autonomy
* Dynamic, growth-oriented company with global reach



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
 



**Start date:** 
 As soon as possible
 



**Working hours:** 
 Full-time
 



  





 📩 Apply now and help us deliver cutting-edge EV charging solutions!
 



  





**Contact:** 
 Apply directly on LinkedIn or send your resume to
 **recruitment1.eu@autel.com** 




  





 👉 Please mention
 *Technical Support Engineer - BESS / EV Charger (m/w/d) – SE* 
 in the email subject.

title: Ansvarig Kundsupport
description:
**Ansvarig Kundsupport och Admin** 
  
 



  





 Mekina AB har på kort tid skapat sig ett starkt namn i byggbranschen och är idag det självklara valet för reparation av elverktyg. För att klara av att bibehålla goda kundrelationer behöver vi hjälp av någon som kan komma in och ta ansvaret för att äga kommunikationen med kunder vi inte möter i butik eller vid servicedisk.  
 



  





 Det här är en roll där man är ansiktet utåt i telefon och mail där du blir den första som möter kund. Det finns så klart kollegor på verkstaden, kontor eller butik som man kan komma att behöva koppla till, men med tiden så ska de flesta frågor kunna besvaras av kundsupporten.   
 



  
 



 Det finns väldigt många olika frågor kunderna kan ha och det kommer ta tid att lära sig allt. Därför är personlighet viktigt. Tålamod, trägenhet, skinn på näsan, mycket glädje och vilja att lära. De flesta som jobbar på Mekina har arbetat här i flera år och vill fortsätta göra det med kollegor som vill detsamma.  
 



  
 



 Du är snabb och effektiv. Du behöver inte vara en digital trollkarl, men datorn ska inte vara något mystiskt som man helst inte använder. Du skriver snabbt och kan håll organisation bland ordrar, frågor, serviceärenden, inköpskommunikation mm i företagets mailkorgar.  
 



  
 



 Idag behöver vi en person, men någon gång inom överskådlig framtid behöver vi en till och då ska processer mm ha satts upp för hur Mekina arbetar med sina kunder. Det är du som får leda det arbetet.  
 



  
 



 Det är inget krav, men det skulle vara positivt att ha arbetet mot bygg och hantverk tidigare. 
 



  
 



 Arbetsuppgifter:  
 


* Primäransvarig för kundsupportkommunikation på mail och telefon.
* Ta emot och registrera kunderorders och serviceärenden.
* Uppföljning kring kundleveranser med leverantör.
* Administrativa uppgifter som kan innefatta hjälp med fakturering, order- och posthantering.
* Bistå VD/Vice VD/Styrelseordförande med diverse administrativa uppgifter vid behov.



  





 Meriterande:  
 


* Tidigare arbete mot byggsektorn och framför allt med maskinförsäljning
* Kundservice och orderläggningserfarenhet



  





 Krav:  
 


* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  
 



  





**På Mekina ser vi våra medarbetare som vår viktigaste tillgång och därför erbjuder vi följande:** 
  
 


* Kollektivavtal
* Tjänstepension
* Friskvårdsbidrag och andra personalförmåner
* Försäkringar
* Marknadsmässig lön
* Karriär och utveckling



  





 Arbetsplats: Solna, kontorsarbete. Ej remote-arbete, annat än i undantagsfall.    
 



 Omfattning: Heltid 
 



 Arbetstider: 07:30-16:30   
 



 Lön: Enligt överenskommelse

title: AI Automation Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Architect and implement agentic AI frameworks, enabling autonomous agents to perform complex tasks across enterprise environments.
* Lead the integration of GitHub Copilot into development and testing workflows, optimizing code generation, review, and deployment.
* Define and execute AI testing strategies, including evaluation pipelines, data validation, and CI/CD integration.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to scale AI automation practices and ensure alignment with enterprise goals.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Proven experience with agentic AI architectures, including multi-agent orchestration and autonomous decision-making systems.
* Strong proficiency in GitHub, including Copilot, Actions, and repository management for AI-driven development.
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Copilot Studio, prompt engineering, and secure data handling.
* Advanced programming skills in Python, with experience in API integration and automated pipelines.
* Familiarity with AI principles such as fairness, reliability, and transparency, and their application in enterprise environments.


**Meritorious**
* Experience in quality engineering with deep hands-on experience in Test automation frameworks integrated with AI capabilities.
* Exposure to test automation in DBT/Python environments, especially in migration or transformation contexts.
* Knowledge of Copilot agents like Writing Coach, Prompt Coach, and Visual Creator, and ability to customize them for business needs.


**Application deadline:** 
 27-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title:
Jobb
Projektledare infrastruktur
description:
Projektledare infrastruktur
   

  

**Trafikverket**
 Solna
   

  

 Ansök senast: 2025-11-05
   

  

 Sök jobbet här
   

  

 Som projektledare på Trafikverket är du med och underlättar vardagen för invånare och företagare i hela Sverige. Det gör du genom att vara med och bidra till framtidens infrastruktur.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Sjöfarten i Sverige står inför stora förändringar. På Trafikverket Färjerederiet genomgår vi en förändringsprocess mot elektrifiering, klimatanpassning, automatisering som kommer att påverka våra 70 färjor, 750 medarbetare och våra 22 miljoner passagerare. Trafikverket Färjerederiet vill vara i framkant och driva utvecklingen mot mer hållbara och smarta lösningar.
   

  

 Enligt vår långsiktiga plan, Vision 45, arbetar Trafikverket Färjerederiet med att uppnå koldioxidneutral färjedrift till 2045. Vi jobbar med elektrifiering av färjorna och Vision 45 öppnar även upp för att använda smarta digitala lösningar för att nå klimatmålen. För att uppnå målen behöver vi nu anställa en projektledare på vår teknik- och miljöavdelning. Tjänsten är placerad på Trafikverkets regionkontor i Stockholm/Solna. Eventuellt kan annan arbetsort diskuteras.
   

  

 Som projektledare för våra landanläggningar kommer du att ingå i teknik- och miljöavdelningen som för nuvarande består av 16 medarbetare, en underhållschef och en teknik- och miljöchef. Våra landanläggningar består av färjelägen, elanläggningar (starkström) för färjornas laddinfrastruktur, automatförtöjningar samt färjevaktstugor. Projekten kan vara belägna i olika delar av landet. Resor i arbetet kommer att krävas.
   

  

 Teknik- och miljöavdelningen har en central roll inom Trafikverket Färjerederiet och utgör ett stöd samtidigt som den driver på fortsatt utveckling. För anpassning till miljö- och klimatkrav kommer stor del av arbetsuppgifterna handla om att skapa förutsättningar på land för att vi skall kunna elektrifiera våra färjor. I samverkan med operativ drift, distrikt och varv svarar avdelningen för att resultatenheten har effektivt stöd inom teknikområdet.
   

  

 Projekten kan spänna över alla olika skeden mellan förstudieskedet till produktion. Du kommer driva fler projekt parallellt. Dessa projekt skiljer sig till viss del men har komplexitet avseende krav på funktion av ny teknik gällande t.ex. robusthet, kvalitet och säkerhet. Projekten har också pågående färjetrafik under byggnationen vilket ställer höga krav på god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga.
   

  

 Några av de arbetsuppgifter du kommer att ha är:
   

  

* vara projektledare för olika typer av projekt kopplade till rederiets landanläggningar
* självständigt starta upp, genomföra, dokumentera och förvalta projekt
* ansvara för att följa upp teknik, miljö, kvalité, tid, ekonomi och arbetsmiljö i projektens olika skeden
* upprätta mindre tekniska specifikationer
* delta i upphandling av konsulter och entreprenörer
* vara stöd i tekniklösnings-, upphandlings- och garantifrågor
* söka erforderliga tillstånd och hantera kontakter med berörda myndigheter och leverantörer
* ansvara för kommunikation gentemot interna och externa projektintressenter
* hämta ut och registrera handlingar i trafikverkets förvaltningssystem
* bevaka och delta vid upprättande av ram/avropsavtal


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Du behöver trivas i en roll med stort ansvar där du är flexibel, självgående och har god förmåga att samarbeta och bygga relationer med både kollegor, chefer och externa individer/grupper. Du är mål- och lösningsorienterad och drivs av utveckling och ständiga förbättringar. Du har hög integritet och ett etiskt och moraliskt förhållningssätt. Tjänsten ställer även stora krav på din förmåga att kommunicera. Projektledaren kommer att vara länken mellan verksamheten, kravställarna och leverantörerna och därför är ett strukturerat arbetssätt viktigt.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har en en civilingenjörs- eller högskoleexamen inom samhällsbyggnad alternativt annan utbildning/examen i kombination med erfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig
* har minst fem års erfarenhet av att självständigt leda och driva byggprojekt eller elkraftsprojekt mot uppsatta mål avseende tid, kostnad och innehåll varav minst 2 år som projektledare i beställarorganisation
* har erfarenhet från upphandlingar av konsulter och entreprenader genom LOU
* har erfarenhet av arbete med budget, prognoser och ekonomisk uppföljning
* talar och skriver svenska obehindrat
* har körkort för personbil


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har erfarenhet av el- och kraftförsörjning


 Övrig information
   

  

 I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet.
   

  

 För att undvika att du missar viktig information om din ansökan behöver du se till att hålla dig uppdaterad via ”Min karriärsida”! Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss! Du kan med fördel även lägga till den mejladressen i dina mejlkontakter.
   

  

 Vill du ha en flexibel vardag med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån? I den här rollen kan du jobba på distans upp till två dagar i veckan.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta ansvarig chef för rekryteringen så att din ansökan blir hanterad enligt särskilda rutiner. Du hittar namn och kontaktuppgifter till chefen i annonsen.
   

  

 På Trafikverkets färjerederi är du med och bidrar till att 22 miljoner personresor och 13 miljoner fordonstransporter varje år sker så effektivt, hållbart och säkert som möjligt. Trafikverkets färjerederi är Sveriges största rederi med runt 70 vägfärjor som trafikerar över 40 färjeleder. När vattnet fryser i de norra delarna av vårt land ansvarar vi även för drift och underhåll av isvägar.
   

  

 Ansök senast
   

  

 Din ansökan ska ha inkommit senast 2025-11-05
   

  

 Kontakter

title: Information Technology Support Specialist
description:
**IT Support Specialist to fast-growing tech company** 




  





**About the Role** 




*Our client – a fast-growing, international tech company – is looking for a IT Support Specialist to ensure every employee is productive from day one.* 




*In this role, you’ll take ownership of device and access management, technical onboarding, and end-user support for a distributed team of 100+ people.* 




*This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys hands-on IT operations, building processes from scratch, and creating structure in a fast-moving, collaborative environment.* 




  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Administer and optimize Google Workspace, including email, file sharing, and endpoint security.
* Manage device onboarding, configuration, and compliance for Macs, iPhones, and Android (BYOD) via Jamf, Kolide, and Google Workspace MDM.
* Oversee technical onboarding and offboarding to ensure smooth, consistent employee experiences.
* Maintain and improve the asset register, vendor relations, and equipment leasing agreements.
* Review and streamline SaaS licensing and subscriptions, ensuring cost efficiency and compliance.
* Create clear documentation and IT process guidelines (in Notion) to support scalability.
* Support internal security and access management, identifying areas for improvement.
* Provide hands-on IT support and act as the go-to person for troubleshooting and employee IT requests.
* Continuously reduce manual work by introducing automation and better workflows.



  





**Who You Are** 



* You’re a self-starter who enjoys taking ownership and driving improvements.
* You’re confident and communicative, comfortable speaking with stakeholders across departments.
* You’re structured and process-oriented, able to turn “we just figure it out” into clear, repeatable workflows.
* You’re service-minded but not afraid to set boundaries and enforce policies.
* You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where autonomy and accountability go hand in hand.



  





**Your Background** 



* A few years’ experience in Corporate IT, IT Support, or Systems Administration, ideally in a tech or SaaS company.
* Hands-on experience with Google Workspace administration, Jamf, and Apple device management.
* Familiar with SSO/IAM solutions and MDM tools.
* Comfortable working in hybrid or remote-first environments.
* Experience building IT documentation and processes from the ground up.



  





**Why Join?** 




 You’ll step into a role where your impact will be tangible from day one. You’ll bring structure to a growing tech organization, define how IT support and onboarding should work, and help create a scalable foundation for the future.
 



 This is a role for someone who wants both autonomy and influence – with the trust and freedom to make things happen.
 



  





**About the assignment** 




 As a consultant with Inhouse, you’ll experience our core values in action – collaboration, personal engagement, and challenge.
 



 We offer a competitive salary, wellness allowance, pension contributions, and full coverage under our collective agreement.
 



  





 We love staying connected with our consultants and make sure to have fun together! You’ll be invited to regular activities such as lunches, consultant meetups, and social events. A close and supportive relationship is important to us, and our consultant managers are always present, professional, and committed.
 



  





 With Inhouse, you can choose whether to be employed by us or invoice through your own company. Either way, you can set high expectations of us as your employer and partner. Nothing matters more to us than ensuring you feel secure, valued, and happy — both in your assignment and as part of our consultant community. We care deeply about your professional growth and aim to offer exciting assignments across many different types of organizations.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 Apply easily with your CV directly on our website or via Linkedin.
 



 We do not require a personal letter, and applications via email are not accepted. Don’t wait to apply — selection and interviews are conducted continuously.
 



 Once your application has been submitted, you’ll receive clear feedback on the next steps in the process. The recruitment process may include selection questions and occupational psychological assessments.
 



 For more information, please contact
 **Thomas Torninger** 
 at
 **thomas.torninger@inhouse.se** 




  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**Good to Know** 




 This is a consultant assignment where you will be employed by Inhouse (or invoice us through your own company) and work on-site with our client.
 **The assignment is full-time (100%) for 6 months, starting ASAP. With an option to extend or be recruited by our client.**

title: Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsoft
description:
Är du passionerad om cybersäkerhet och vill arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Microsofts ekosystem? Vill du vara en del av ett team där innovation, kompetens och gemenskap står i centrum? Då kan det här vara ditt nästa steg!
   

  

**Om rollen – Din chans att stärka cybersäkerheten i framkant! 🛡️**
 Som
 **Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsoft** 
 hos oss får du en
 **central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder skydda sina IT-miljöer** 
 . Du kommer att:
   

  

* Analysera och identifiera säkerhetsbehov hos våra kunder, med fokus på Microsofts ekosystem.
* Utforma och implementera säkerhetslösningar som skyddar mot dagens och morgondagens hot.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom cybersäkerhet.
* Samarbeta med olika team för att skapa säkra, effektiva och hållbara IT-lösningar.
* Utbilda och vägleda kunder i bästa praxis för en säker digital arbetsmiljö.


 Den här rollen är perfekt för dig som vill
 **kombinera teknisk expertis med strategiskt tänkande** 
 och samtidigt göra verklig skillnad för företag och organisationer! 🚀
   

  

**Vi söker dig som…**
* Har erfarenhet som konsult inom IT-säkerhet, gärna inom Microsofts ekosystem. ✅ Är kunnig inom identitetshantering, hotdetektering och säkerhetsarkitektur.
* Har erfarenhet av verktyg som Microsoft Defender, Sentinel, Entra ID (tidigare Azure AD) och liknande.
* Är en problemlösare som gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste säkerhetshoten.
* Har en god förståelse för både tekniska och organisatoriska säkerhetsutmaningar.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska, för att det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


**Vad vi erbjuder 💜**
**Flexibilitet** 
 – vi tror på balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Utvecklingsmöjligheter** 
 – utbildningar, certifieringar och nätverkande inom säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**En inkluderande och engagerad företagskultur** 
 – vi tror på att ha kul på jobbet!
   

  

**Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner** 
 – för att du ska känna dig trygg och motiverad.
   

  

**Spännande projekt** 
 – jobba med ledande företag och organisationer i säkerhetskritiska miljöer.
   

  

**Vem är vi? 🤗**
 Vi är
 **B3 Cloud** 
 , en del av B3 Consulting Group – ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag. Vi hjälper våra kunder att bygga framtidens IT-miljöer genom modern molnteknik och cybersäkerhet. Vi är ett
 **team på cirka 40 experter inom moln och säkerhet** 
 , och vi älskar att samarbeta, utvecklas och lösa komplexa utmaningar tillsammans! 💡
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*
 💌
 **Låter det spännande?** 
 Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: Senior DevOps Architect
description:
As a Senior DevOps Architect, you’ll shape the technical strategy, architecture, and culture that enable hundreds of engineers to deliver faster, safer, and smarter.
   

  

 You’ll act as both strategic advisor and hands-on enabler, bridging architecture, automation, and leadership across Traton’s global software factory initiatives.
   

  

**Your Future Job**
 You will be part of the DevOps team with creative colleagues and will work in close cooperation with all teams in the project, located both in Sweden and abroad, representing multiple nationalities.
   

  

**Examples of tasks:**
* Define and evolve Traton’s DevOps strategy within the DDU SW Factory
* Using Amazon Web Services (AWS) services such as S3 for object storage, EC2 for virtual server instances, and VPC for networking and security
* Defining an efficient branching strategy and merging approach
* Collaborate across departments to align tooling, processes, and governance
* Drive innovation in deployment models, container orchestration, and automation pipelines
* Design scalable, automated CI/CD frameworks across hybrid and multi-cloud environments
* Evolving DevOps AI practices, integrating AI and machine learning into DevOps workflows for smarter automation, predictive insights, and continuous optimization
* Mentor engineering teams, lead architectural reviews, and guide platform evolution


**Your Profile**
* You are a communicative and cooperative person who takes responsibility for creating and maintaining a great development environment. You have solid experience working as a DevOps professional in larger projects, preferably within the automotive industry.
* With 5–10 years of experience in DevOps and infrastructure roles, you bring both technical depth and an architectural perspective. You have a strategic mindset and are comfortable driving strategic changes that improve processes, tooling, and ways of working across teams.
* Your technical background includes strong knowledge of AWS, GIT, Docker, JIRA, programming, and reading various data formats such as XML, JSON, and YAML. Experience with Android and QNX operating system is highly beneficial.
* You have a B.Sc or M.Sc degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar along with relevant work experience.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2025-11-06. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

**For more information**
 Please contact :
   

  

 Thomas Richter (Manager TGRAVGS)
   

  

 thomas.richter@scania.com

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As an MLOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role designing, building, and maintaining the core infrastructure that powers our machine learning applications. You will streamline the entire ML lifecycle, helping us pioneer solutions that tackle complex challenges in music search, recommendation, and audio modification, reliably reaching users and creators worldwide.
 



 You will join a team of MLOps engineers within a larger, cross-functional group, collaborating closely with Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and product development teams. This role offers the chance to work with a modern tech stack while actively shaping our future by implementing next-generation technologies.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Design, build, and maintain scalable infrastructure for training and serving our machine learning models using Kubernetes (GKE).
* Develop and optimize CI/CD pipelines to streamline the entire ML application lifecycle, from development to production.
* Implement and manage robust ML monitoring and observability solutions to ensure the reliability of our production models.
* Collaborate with ML and Data Engineers to build efficient data pipelines and integrate tools like Vertex AI for pipelining and feature stores.



  





**Requirements** 



* Proven experience in MLOps, with a deep understanding of best practices like ML monitoring and CI/CD for machine learning.
* Proficiency with Kubernetes in a production environment.
* Hands-on experience with pipeline orchestration tools such as Vertex AI Pipelines, Kubeflow Pipelines, Flyte, or Metaflow.
* Infrastructure as Code skills, particularly with Terraform.
* Experience with cloud-native data processing services like Dataflow or Airflow.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience with Google Cloud Platform services like BigQuery and Google Cloud Storage.
* Knowledge of advanced data engineering practices.
* Familiarity with observability tools for production infrastructure (e.g., Grafana, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry).
* Experience with serverless inference frameworks such as Seldon Core.
* Familiarity with Music Information Retrieval.



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in
 
 here
 
 - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe***

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 41,000+ GitHub Stars.
   

  

 At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.
   

  

 By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.
   

  

 At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data
   

  

 What would you do at Prisma?
   

  

**We Anticipate You To Be Responsible For**
* People: Empower your engineering team to achieve technical excellence and meaningful impact by ensuring they have the support and resources to do their best work. This includes providing constructive feedback, creating learning and growth opportunities, and challenging them to improve. Help them understand why their work matters and how it aligns with company-wide KPIs. We believe that strong, healthy teams start with investing in people.
* Process: Optimize and refine development processes and technical practices to drive continuous improvement. We believe in relentless optimization—if something can be done better, we find a way. You will lead engineering team meetings to plan and prioritize work, run retrospectives to identify improvements, and establish policies that enhance communication, collaboration, and code quality.
* Delivery: Success for your team means consistently delivering high-quality software that provides value while maintaining a sustainable pace. You will collaborate closely with the Product Manager to prioritize product initiatives, define the roadmap, and drive technical improvements.


 An Ideal Candidate Profile
   

  

 We believe the right candidate for this position should meet a majority of the criteria listed below.
   

  

* 8+ Years proven leadership in software engineering teams, with hands-on experience as a software engineer. Specifically a strong understanding of
* Experience in database and backend technologies, including TypeScript, SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, MongoDB, SQL Server), and familiarity with cloud services, APIs (GraphQL/REST), and developer tooling is a plus.
* High standards for quality, ensuring excellence while balancing pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency—taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* Focused on helping your team understand the why.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal—able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, give and receive constructive feedback effectively, and foster collaboration across teams.
* You have a structured thought process, approaching problems methodically and making well-reasoned decisions. You plan effectively, setting clear goals, anticipating challenges, and ensuring smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.


 What's it like to work at Prisma?
   

  

 You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...
   

  

* ... have an ownership mindset. As an Engineering Manager, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* ... stay nimble. It's a startup, things change and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* ... be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 We put our people first. Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.
   

  

* An opportunity to lead the team shaping Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications — see what we’re building.
* A Fun and Supportive Team that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* Fully Remote Work with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* Generous Time Off, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* Parental Benefits, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* Sabbatical Leave, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* Mental Health Support, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* Tech budge to equip you with the tools you need.
* Annual Off-sites, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* Relocation Support, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* [US] Health and Pension Benefits, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.


 Remote Work
   

  

 To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone
 ****GMT -2 to GMT +3****
 for this position.
   

  

 What is our hiring process like?
   

  

* Introductory Call with our Head of Engineering
* Take Home Assignment where you will share some of your thoughts and approaches to management.
* Team Interview with some of the engineers that form part of your team.
* Leadership Interview with our COO.
* Final Interview \*\*with our CEO.
* Offer


 The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.
   

  

 If you believe that this is the right position for you then please send your resume along with any supporting documentation or information to us via the link provided on this page. We typically respond within 7 business days.
   

  

 In line with our
 **Fair Treatment and Equal Opportunity Policy**
 , as well as our
 **Disability Policy**
 , Prisma follows fair and merit-based hiring practices, ensuring all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, experience, and qualifications. We do not make hiring decisions based on
 **age**
 ,
 **race**
 ,
 **ethnicity, sex, gender identity, parental or caregiver status, trade union membership, disability, religious belief or lack of belief, life expectancy, sexual orientation, genetic information**
 , or
 **veteran or military status.**

title: VP of Platform Engineering
description:
Join us at Kivra! At Kivra, we are building services that connect over 6 million people with more than 50 000 senders in both the private and public sector. We provide a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use.
 



 Now we’re looking for a VP of Platform Engineering to lead the next chapter of our technical journey — ensuring that Kivra continues to scale securely, reliably, and sustainably.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As VP of Platform Engineering, you’ll lead and grow the teams that design, build, and operate Kivra’s technical foundation.
 



 You’ll be responsible for our core platform, ensuring that our services are robust, scalable, and built to handle millions of secure digital interactions every day.
 



 You’ll manage and coach several engineering managers and technical leads — fostering a culture of learning, ownership, and craftsmanship. You’ll also play an active role in strategic architecture discussions, infrastructure modernization, and hands-on technical direction. You will report to and partner up with our CTO.
 



 At Kivra, our Platform Engineering organization supports the entire product ecosystem, enabling fast and reliable development across our domains and cross-functional teams. This role is both strategic and hands-on, combining a people-first mindset with technical excellence.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




  




* **Define and drive the vision and roadmap** 
 for Kivra’s platform — across infrastructure data and core services.



  




* **Lead and develop multiple engineering teams** 
 , ensuring they are happy, motivated, and empowered to grow.



  




* **Mentor engineering managers and developers** 
 , reinforcing high-quality engineering practices and a collaborative mindset.



  




* **Provide technical direction** 
 and ensure best practices in reliability, scalability, and security.



  




* **Foster a “You build it - You own it”-culture** 
 based on continuous improvement, enabling automation, observability and operational excellence.



  




* **Collaborate cross-functionally** 
 with product, data, and infrastructure teams in order to ensure that platform capabilities align with Kivra’s business and user needs.



  




* **Guide architectural decisions** 
 across backend and infrastructure domains, using technologies like Erlang, Elixir, Go, Kubernetes, and GCP.



  




* **Contribute to technical discussions** 
 and,lead by example — by participating in design reviews, operational incidents, and key technical initiatives.



  





**About you** 




 Knowledge is important, but so is attitude!
 



 Kivra’s culture is rooted in collaboration, trust and the drive to build high-quality products. We believe that great people build great things together. As VP of Platform Engineering, you’ll have a significant impact on how our teams work — enabling a culture built on collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
 



  





 We believe you:
 


* Have extensive experience leading platform, infrastructure, or backend engineering teams in complex environments.



  




* Have a strong technical foundation, ideally with experience in Erlang/Elixir, Go, Kubernetes and cloud platforms (GCP/AWS).



  




* Are a hands-on leader who can support your teams with technical direction, trade-offs and system architecture.



  




* Are passionate about building reliable, secure, and scalable systems, and value simplicity and automation.



  




* Are a strategic thinker who can align technical decisions with long-term business goals.



  




* Thrive in agile and DevOps environments, and believe in short feedback loops, continuous delivery, and learning.



  




* Communicate clearly and empathetically — with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



  





 It’s also a plus if you have previous experience working in regulated or security-sensitive domains (fintech, govtech, digital identity).
 



  





**What we offer** 




 Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.
 



 We offer the flexibility that life sometimes requires, but we believe that collaboration and value creation happens best when we sit and work together from our office in central Stockholm. Fluency in English is required; Swedish is a plus but not required. We are unable to sponsor new work permits, but can sponsor/renew existing permits.
 



 We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com!

title: Specialists in Artificial Intelligence and its impact on education, training and employment
description:

**Location:** 
 Europe

 Project-Based/Consultancy

 Rolling Applications

 We are creating a pool of
 **Artificial Intelligence and its impact on education, training and employment experts** 
 for European Training Foundation (ETF) projects in Europe. Experts in this pool will be contacted for specific assignments as they arise. If you have relevant experience, we encourage you to apply.
 



**Requirements:**

* At least 15 years of relevant professional experience of which at least 10 years related to Artificial Intelligence and its impact on education, training and employment for Cat.I experts;

 Interested candidates should submit their CV and a brief statement of interest to recruitment@ntu.eu on a rolling basis. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted when relevant projects arise.
 



  





*Inclusion in the expert pool does not guarantee immediate assignment but provides access to project opportunities as they become available.*

title: Technical Test Coordinator
description:
**Join our Team**
 As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, crafting the future of technology. This is a place where you're encouraged to be your own magnificently outstanding self and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.
   

  

**Our Exciting Opportunity!**
 Core Network Solutions, part of Ericsson Cloud Common & Solutions Development Unit (PDU CLCS), is now looking for an ambitious and creative Technical Test Coordinator (TTC) with telecom business experience, wanting to further learn and grow together with us.
   

  

 As TTC, you will work in 5GC E2E Quality Assurance(QA) Program.
   

  

 The QA program is responsible for quality assurance of 5GC (CNFs) and cloud products (CNIS) via performing network-level integration and verification (E2E test).
   

  

 You will work closely with a larger team whose members are based in other regions of Sweden and abroad.
   

  

 Our office is located in the scenic and vibrant Lindholmen area in the central parts of Gothenburg, just on the shore of the Göta Älv river.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Ensure the proper quality assurance with effective test scope and efficient test policies
* Be accountable for the “test quality” and be owner of "test scope", by reviewing test analysis and release need as well as coordinating test activities both inside and outside the respective Program setup
* Collaborate with different parties (e.g. requirements/system manager, product development, QA teams) and other stakeholders to achieve the best product quality
* Be part of the Solutions TTC community, developing, improving, communicating and supporting deployment of the solution-level test strategy
* Drive changes in the test method, test management and test process/wow during the transformation to automate and adopt AI


**The Skills You Bring:**
* Love testing and have a strong belief in the importance of quality assurance
* Have the focus and ambition to understand customer needs and can transfer that to practical work and improvements
* Have the talent to see the big picture, challenge current methods, and define the future and vision of how we test our product
* Be used to take the lead in discussions regarding scope, activities and strategies related to test
* Want to continuously develop your knowledge through experience as well as learning, collaboration, and sharing knowledge with others
* Feel natural about mentoring teams on how to achieve the vital needs
* Have a passion to continuously improve the test way of working


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field
* Proven expertise in 5G Core products and functions, network architecture
* Strong knowledge of Cloud Native Architecture, including microservices and containerization technologies
* Excellent problem-solving abilities, ensuring data-driven decisions and navigation through complex technical challenges.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, effectively coordinating cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Hands-on experience with testing methodologies and CI/CD pipelines, especially with load testing
* Python programming is a plus
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken


**Application:**
 We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV/resume in English.
   

  

**Application deadline** 
 : 14th of November 2025
   

  

**Location:** 
 Gothenburg, Sweden
   

  

**Work setup:** 
 We aim for approximately 60% on-site presence at our office.
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept or process applications submitted via email.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 Sweden (SE) || Göteborg
